articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Manager at Turkish jet operator told authorities he helped Ghosn escape because of threats- newspaper
articles.description: A manager at Turkish jet operator MNG Jet has told authorities that he assisted unwittingly in the escape of ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn from Japan because he had been threatened by a former acquaintance, Hurriyet newspaper reported on Saturday.
articles.content: ISTANBUL, Jan 4 (Reuters) - A manager at Turkish jet operator MNG Jet has told authorities that he assisted unwittingly in the escape of ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn from Japan because he had been threatened by a former acquaintance, Hurriyet newspaper reporte… [+1458 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: UK's Johnson to meet EU chief von der Leyen in London
articles.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson will meet European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in London on Wednesday ahead of the opening rounds of trade talks that will begin once Britain formally leaves the bloc on Jan. 31.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - British Prime Minister Boris Johnson will meet European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in London on Wednesday ahead of the opening rounds of trade talks that will begin once Britain formally leaves the bloc on Jan. 31.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Cricket-India's Pathan announces retirement from all formats
articles.description: Indian all-rounder Irfan Pathan announced his retirement from all forms of the game on Saturday, bringing the curtain down on an illustrious career which included a World Twenty20 triumph.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Indian all-rounder Irfan Pathan announced his retirement from all forms of the game on Saturday, bringing the curtain down on an illustrious career which included a World Twenty20 triumph.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: France discusses Middle East tensions with Germany and China
articles.description: French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian said he had discussed the situation in the Middle East on Saturday with his German and Chinese counterparts, and added that all three had agreed on the need to avoid any escalation in tensions.
articles.content: PARIS, Jan 4 (Reuters) - French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian said he had discussed the situation in the Middle East on Saturday with his German and Chinese counterparts, and added that all three had agreed on the need to avoid any escalation in tension… [+451 chars]

articles.author: John Mair
articles.title: Bushfires rage out of control across southeast Australia
articles.description: Bushfires burned dangerously out of control on Australia's east coast on Saturday, fanned by high temperatures and strong winds that had firefighters battling to save lives and property, as a change in wind conditions merged several large fire fronts.
articles.content: SYDNEY/MELBOURNE (Reuters) - Bushfires burned dangerously out of control on Australia’s east coast on Saturday, fanned by high temperatures and strong winds that had firefighters battling to save lives and property, as a change in wind conditions merged sever… [+4620 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Security firm ended Ghosn's surveillance: sources
articles.description: Reuters has learned that lawyers for Carlos Ghosn warned a private security company that its surveillance of Carlos Ghosn's home was a human rights abuse. He escaped house arrest shortly after the firm stopped watching his Tokyo home.
articles.content:
Posted 
Reuters has learned that lawyers for Carlos Ghosn warned a private security company that its surveillance of Carlos Ghosn's home was a human rights abuse. He escaped house arrest shortly after the firm stopped watching his Tokyo home.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Atlantia CEO warns of bankruptcy risk if concession revoked: paper
articles.description: Atlantia risks going bankrupt if Italy's government revokes its motorway licence with limited compensation, the infrastructure group's CEO told an Italian daily on Saturday, adding an alternative compromise could be found.
articles.content:
